summary: This bill, the "DRAIN THE SWAMP Act", mandates that federal executive agencies relocate at least 30% of their headquarters employees outside the Washington metropolitan area within a year of enactment. It defines key terms like "headquarters employee" and "Washington metropolitan area." Agencies must report on employee relocation plans and reduce headquarters office space by 30%. Relocation incentives are prohibited. The bill includes provisions for pay locality adjustments, promotes geographic diversity, and addresses full-time telework. Furthermore, it outlines how the changes will be integrated in budget justification materials and supersedes any other provision of law, collective bargaining agreements, or master labor agreements.
